glsa.title: IcedTea: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in IcedTea allowing remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability through various vectors.

background.p: IcedTeaâ€™s aim is to provide OpenJDK in a form suitable for easy configuration, compilation and distribution with the primary goal of allowing inclusion in GNU/Linux distributions.

description.p: Various OpenJDK attack vectors in IcedTea, such as 2D, Corba, Hotspot, Libraries, and JAXP, exist which allows remote attackers to affect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of vulnerable systems. Many of the vulnerabilities can only be exploited through sandboxed Java Web Start applications and java applets. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: Remote attackers may execute arbitrary code, compromise information, or cause Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known work around at this time.

resolution.p: Gentoo Security is no longer supporting dev-java/icedtea, as it has been officially dropped from the stable tree.
